import ase
from ase.calculators.vasp import Vasp
from ase import units as un
from pathlib import Path
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

hecss_sampler[source]

hecss_sampler(fname:"Basic structure file. Any type recognized by ASE is accepted."='CONTCAR', work_dir:"Work directory"='WORK', label:"Label for the calculations. This got appended to work directory"='hecss', T:"Target temperature in Kelvin"=300, calc:"ASE calculator to be used for the job. Supported calculators: VASP (default)"='VASP', N:"Number of samples to be generated"=10)

Run HECSS parser on the structure in the directory.
{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
samples = hecss_sampler("example/VASP_3C-SiC/1x1x1/sc_1x1x1/CONTCAR", 
                        work_dir='TMP', T=600, N=100)

Run HECSS on example/VASP_3C-SiC/1x1x1/sc_1x1x1/CONTCAR at 600K in TMP directory using VASP.
example/VASP_3C-SiC/1x1x1/sc_1x1x1 CONTCAR
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
plot_stats(samples, 600)
{% endraw %}
